SEARCH
Package bank

Class Security

java.lang.Object
bank.Security
public class Security extends Object
Security class is in charge of the login process and authentication services for bank transactions. A Security object will be generated when the Bank class is initialised. Functions are utilised to validate the authenticity of a user. Uses the PBKDF2 Algorithm from the SecretKeyFactory library for encryption. 

 General usage flow:
 - Use Security() constructor to start the security session in the bank
 - Use validatePassword(int, String) for an existing account's login process 
 - OR use createNewPass(int, String) for adding a new account and then use validatePassword() to log user in
 - Use createNewPass() to also change account credentials 
 - Use generateTransactionOTP(int, int) followed by validateOTP(int, String) for the OTP process

Dependency: UserPass.csv data file for storing account ID and encrypted password pairs

  • Constructor Details

    • Security

      public Security(int otpExpirySeconds)
      Constructor for security class called on Bank initialisation. Creates a Security class object. Sets the OTP validity duration and populates @see #userPwdMap with values from the password CSV file, UserPass.csv.
      Parameters:
      otpExpirySeconds - OTP validity duration in seconds

  • Method Details

    • generateTransactionOTP

      public void generateTransactionOTP(int userId, int passLength)
      Used to generate a one-time user password specific to the user's account for transaction validations. Pre-requisite: Account specified in userID must be part of the system's security database (in UserPass.csv) Adds the OTP to the Hashmap otpMap Key: userId, Value: [otpString,otpValidTime]. Password will be valid within the duration specified in otpExpirySeconds.
      Parameters:
      userId - Account ID value
      passLength - Specifies the OTP string length

    • validateOTP

      public boolean validateOTP(int userId, String otpString)
      Checks if the input argument matches the one found in OTP hashmap, otpMap Method has 3 conditions: Valid User ID, Non-expired OTP and Correct One-time password value If any of the three conditions fail, return a False value. Otherwise, clear the OTP record from otpMap and return True.
      Parameters:
      userId - Integer key variable to use for getting OTP information from otpMap
      otpString - One-time password user input value to compare against existing OTP records
      Returns:
      boolean true on successful validation, false for failed

    • hashPassword

      public byte[] hashPassword(String passString, byte[] salt)
      Converts plain-text passString arg into an encrypted string by adding a cryptographic salt to the plain-text and then hashing it
      Parameters:
      passString - Plain-text password string
      salt - Account-specific salt byte array
      Returns:
      Encrypted password in a byte array

    • validatePassword

      public Boolean validatePassword(int userId, String password)
      Checks if input password matches password stored in password Hashmap, userPwdMap.
      Parameters:
      userId - User's account identification number
      password - Plain-text password user is attempting to login with
      Returns:
      Succesful Login: True, Unsuccesful: False

    • createNewPass

      public void createNewPass(int userId, String password)
      Sets a new encrypted password and salt for user account in the userPwdMap. If no account is associated with userId argument, create a new record in userPwd with password and hashvalue For existing account, changes existing password and hash values associated with account.
      Parameters:
      userId - User account ID to add/change password for
      password - Plain-text password value

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
